TopicTitle: Mobile Processing Lab "sci/day" Rate Computation Bug

Articles.Content: The Mobile Processing Lab "sci/day" Rate Computation appears to be hard-coded based on a 6-hour day, even if the user changes to 24-hour days in the game settings.
I get 2.6 science per day (or so it says) it fills the 500 in 70-80 days rather than ~200.
Sorry to tell you this but it's meant to be per Kerbal day, the 24 hour days option only affects the clock, so you'll get science from the lab four times per Earth day.

Sorry to tell you this but it's meant to be per Kerbal day, the 24 hour days option only affects the clock, so you'll get science from the lab four times per Earth day.

Whether it is intentional or not, it should be changed because a "day" is a "day" per the game setting, so the Lab Module is wrong in that respect.
A day is the time the planet Kerbin takes to spin around it's axis, i.e., 6 hours independent of game settings.
